item.title: About
item.description: <!DOCTYPE html> About us Click on an image to find out about Maker Arts! Our Aim close Our Aim Our aim is to help all learners, regardless of their personal challenges to access engaging educational opportunities to help them achieve their own personal and academic growth. What is Maker Arts? close Maker Arts Maker Arts is an alternative provision offering a creative approach to learning that will benefit young people who are struggling to engage in mainstream school by specialising in developing their social, emotional and mental health alongside a rich and varied arts based learning environment.

item.title: About
item.description: About us Maker Arts CIC is a community interest company based in the heart of Paignton, Torbay. We offer small groups of students aged 9-16 bespoke courses in mindfulness, employability, art and science. Our aims: To develop confidence Facilitate well-being Encourage aspirations We are particularly interested in supporting those that are anxious, phobic or otherwise disadvantaged. Our end goal is to encourage these students back into the classrom. Meet the team Sue Something about sue

item.title: Courses
item.description: Courses We offer three Arts Awards from Trinity College London. Arts Award inspires young people to grow their arts and leadership talents: it’s creative, valuable and accessible. Qualifications Discover: An introductory award aimed at young people under 25. Explore: An entry Level 3 award aimed at young people aged 8 to 16. Bronze: The Bronze Arts Award is a Level 1 qualification on the Regulated Qualifications Framework (RQF) and is open to young people aged 11 to 25.

Arts Award inspires young people to grow their arts and leadership talents: it’s creative, valuable and accessible. Qualifications Discover: An introductory award aimed at young people under 25 Bronze: The Bronze Arts Award is a Level 1 qualification on the Regulated Qualifications Framework (RQF) and is open to young people aged 11 to 25. Silver: The Silver Arts Award is a Level 2 qualification on the Regulated Qualifications Framework (RQF) and is designed for ages 14 and above, but is open to young people aged 11 to 25.

item.title: Privison
item.description: Our Provisions Employability Programme The next steps into further education or careers can be daunting. Aimed at those in upper secondary school our bespoke employability programme encouraged young people to research job opportunities, try out ‘simulated work’ roles in our purpose build work environments and well as out in our community. In addition to CV writing, interview skills all delivered in a fun, engaging and creative way whilst working towards gaining qualifications.
